definitions.definition: a formal discussion on a particular topic in a public meeting or legislative assembly, in which opposing arguments are put forward.
examples: discussion, discourse, parley, dialogue; Moreargument, counterargument, dispute, wrangle, war of words; argumentation, disputation, dissension, disagreement, contention, conflict; negotiations, talks; informalconfab, powwow "a debate on the reforms"Moreargument, counterargument, dispute, wrangle, war of words; argumentation, disputation, dissension, disagreement, contention, conflict; negotiations, talks; confab, powwow a debate on the reforms

definitions.definition: an argument about a particular subject, especially one in which many people are involved.
argue about (a subject), especially in a formal manner.
synonyms: bat around "they will debate the future of rail transport"

definitions.definition: consider a possible course of action in one's mind before reaching a decision.
examples: he debated whether he should leave the matter alone or speak to her
synonyms: meditate; formalcogitate "he debated whether to call her"
